intro: Leucopogon ellipticus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf heath, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths, heathers, and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its slender, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or acidic soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. Leucopogon ellipticus is well adapted to fire-prone environments and can regenerate quickly after bushfires.
